holidays.name: National Chocolate Cupcake Day
holidays.description: A delicious celebration dedicated to indulging in rich, moist chocolate cupcakes topped with luscious frosting.
holidays.origin: While not officially recognized by any government, this sweet holiday was created by baking enthusiasts to appreciate the beloved chocolate cupcake.
holidays.funFact: Chocolate cupcake sales spike every October 18th as bakers compete to create the most decadent cupcake masterpiece!

holidays.name: Answer Your Cat‚Äôs Questions Day
holidays.description: A quirky day encouraging cat owners to imagine the curious questions their feline friends might be asking and respond thoughtfully.
holidays.origin: This whimsical observance began among online cat lover communities as a way to foster empathy and fun communication with pets.
holidays.funFact: Cats meow primarily to communicate with humans, so this day is perfect for 'translating' what they might really want to say.

holidays.name: No Beard Day
holidays.description: A quirky occasion inviting people who normally sport facial hair to clean-shave and enjoy a smooth, beardless day.
holidays.origin: Started as a social media challenge to raise awareness about the changing styles and cultural perceptions associated with beards.
holidays.funFact: No Beard Day has inspired many men to discover their 'true' face and even spark beard-growing competitions afterward!

holidays.name: Farmers‚Äô Day (Taiwan)
holidays.description: A day dedicated to honoring and appreciating the hard work of farmers who sustain communities with their labor and dedication.
holidays.origin: Established by the Taiwanese government to support and celebrate the agricultural sector‚Äôs contributions to society.
holidays.funFact: Farmers‚Äô Day festivities in Taiwan often include traditional music, food fairs, and contests showcasing farming skills.
